result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Luna was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Antonio Luna is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Antonio Luna was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross. (Bond on file applied)

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.

timeConds.notes: Start within 60 days.   Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.   Defendant is eligible for Electronic Monitoring if approved by the risk assessment and jail administration. (Credit to be determined)

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antonio Luna in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases: 15CF258, 15CF93, 15CF339, 16CF105, 16CF247, 15TR531, and 15TR530.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF258 Count 1:  No Contest
15CF93 Count 1: OWI 4th: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF258 Ct 1 and 15CF93 Ct 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 15CF258 Ct 2, 15CF93 Cts 3, 4, & 5, 15CF339, 16CF105, 16CF247, 15TR531, and 15TR530 are dismissed and read in. 15CF93 Ct 2 is dismissed out right.

ADA Cousin makes sentencing recommendation to the Court. 
Atty Sheets concurs with joint agreement. 

BY THE COURT:**PROBATION**
15CF258 Count 1:
W/H Sentence:
18 mo Probation, concurrent with 15CF93
Conditions: Pay costs + surcharges = $518.00

15CF93 Count 1:
W/H Sentence
18 mo Probation
Conditions:
120 days conditional jail, start within 60 days,   Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.   Defendant is eligible for Electronic Monitoring if approved by the risk assessment and jail administration.
$600 fine + costs + DNA surcharges = $1,769.00
Pay Blood draw costs  =   $26.45 
30 mo Revocation of DL
30 mo IID
DOT Assess/Safety plan
  AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
  Obtain and maintain full-time employment.
  Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Antonio Luna in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:22 a.m. Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Atty Cousins makes statements and would like to withdraw his motion.
Atty Sheets has no objection.
Atty Sheets states that all case should now be tracking.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Eric Sheets in court.  Defendant Antonio Luna appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.

1:20 p.m.  Court calls the case. 
Atty Sheets makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court.  Recommends a $5,000 cash bond. 
Atty Sheets makes arguments to the Court re: bond. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Notice of Motion and Motion to Forfeit Bond filed by the State 
     Cover Letter dated 06/09/16

Attorney Eric Sheets in court.  Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:04 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter was set for a jury trial today.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, spoke with Defendant and decided to cancel today's trial due to the fact Atty Sheets has not had current contact with Defendant.

Atty Sheets addresses the Court, spoke with his client last Friday, Defendant stated he was not going to be available for the trial, is out of town. Atty Sheets notified the State so the trial could be canceled.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, there were plea discussions on the OWI.

State requests a bench warrant and forfeit the $750 cash that was posted. Defendant would have 30 days to appear in Court and explain to the Court his non appearance.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders bench warrant in 15CF-93, body only.
Court will not forfeit the bond at this time.

15CF-258 and 15CF-339 were tracking along, no action taken on them.

**BOND AMENDED AS OF 04/07/16:
*Court grants the motion to modify bond and permit Mr. Luna to withdraw from the pretrial supervision program. 
*That condition will be removed from his bond and replaced with the condition that he report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center on all of his future court dates.
*Modification applies to all outstanding bonds 15CF93, 15CF258, 15CF339 & 16CF105.

Defendant Antonio Luna in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard: 15CF93, 15CF258, 15CF339 & 16CF105

1:38 pm. Court calls case.
Court calls case.
Atty Sheets gives statement.
Atty Cass gives statements.
Atty Sheets indicates that his client is requesting he will be removed from the pretrial supervision program and be allowed to report on court dates.

BY THE COURT:
Court grants the motion to modify bond and permit Mr. Luna to withdraw from the pretrial supervision program. 
That condition will be removed from his bond and replaced with the condition that he report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center on all of his future court dates.
Modification applies to all outstanding bonds.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 8, 2016 at 08:00 am.

This is in addition to the $750 previously posted.

BY THE COURT:  $1,000 cash bond to cover all 3 files.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

sent to JR 11/3/15 ks

BY THE COURT:  Criminal warrant.  Body Only.  Each file.

Defendant Antonio Luna in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
